citations.narrative:
The enclosure did not keep a Fennec Fox safe from injury. On June 11th, 2024, facility staff found an approximately 4
year old male Fennec Fox with his leg entrapped in between the wooden slats of a bench inside of his enclosure. He was
taken immediately to the veterinarian, who diagnosed a coxofemoral luxation (dislocated hip) and provided treatment. The
fennec fox was recently released from cage rest and is still limping. The vet stated that he may need additional surgical
treatment. Enclosures that present entrapment hazards can cause serious injuries to the animals. Enclosures must be
maintained in good repair and protect animals from injury. Corrected prior to inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Brittany Kessler, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
The enclosure did not keep a Fennec Fox safe from injury. On June 11th, 2024, facility staff found an approximately 4 
year old male Fennec Fox with his leg entrapped in between the wooden slats of a bench inside of his enclosure. He was 
taken immediately to the veterinarian, who diagnosed a coxofemoral luxation (dislocated hip) and provided treatment. The 
fennec fox was recently released from cage rest and is still limping. The vet stated that he may need additional surgical 
treatment. Enclosures that present entrapment hazards can cause serious injuries to the animals. Enclosures must be 
maintained in good repair and protect animals from injury. Corrected prior to inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Brittany Kessler, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
